document.docAuthor: Xavier, Cláudia, Ott, Ricardo & Saturnino, Regiane
document.docTitle: Camillina kuarup Xavier & Ott & Saturnino 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of Camillina Berland, 1919 (Araneae: Gnaphosidae) from Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of Camillina Berland, 1919 (Araneae: Gnaphosidae) from Brazil

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Museu Paraense Emílio Goeldi (MPEG), Coordenação de Zoologia, Laboratório de Aracnologia, Avenida Perimetral, 1901, Terra Firme, Cep: 66077 - 830, Belém, Pará, Brasil. & Programa de Bolsas de Iniciação Científica-PIBIC, CNPq e Programa de Pós-Graduação em Zoologia do MPEG e Universidade Federal do Pará - Mestrado / CAPES.

Secretaria do Meio Ambiente e Infraestrutura (SEMA), Departamento de Biodiversidade (DBIO), Divisão de Pesquisa Manutenção de Coleções Científicas (DPMCC), Rua Dr. Salvador França, 1427, Jardim Botânico, Cep: 90690 - 000, Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul, Brasil.

Programa de Capacitação Institucional-PCI / MPEG, CNPq, Coordenação de Ciências da Terra e Ecologia, Laboratório de Modelagem Ecológica. & Universidade Estadual da Região Tocantina do Maranhão (UEMASUL), Centro de Ciências Exatas, Naturais e Tecnológicas (CCENT). Avenida Godofredo Viana, 1300, Centro, Cep: 65901 - 480, Imperatriz, Maranhão, Brasil.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The specific epithet refers to a ritual tribute to the illustrious dead celebrated by the indigenous people of the Xingu.

Diagnosis . Males of
Camillina kuarup
resemble those of
C. tarapaca Platnick & Shadab, 1982
, by the shape of the embolus, but differ from the last by a larger retrolateral tibial apophysis and a robuster U-shaped spermatic duct positioned along the border of the tegulum ( Figs 10–12 ; 44–49 ), while in
C. tarapaca
the duct has a sinuous loop in the prolateral portion of the tegulum, and the retrolateral tibial apophysis has a narrower tip (see Platnick & Shadab, 1982 : figs 91, 92). Females resemble those of
C. tarapaca
, by the position of the secondary spermathecae, but differ from the last by a longer and wider median field with shorter copulatory ducts and a larger spermathecae relative to the median field width which are also located closer to the median field ( Figs 13–14 ; Platnick & Shadab, 1982 : figs 93, 94).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 15–21 .
Camillina bonaldoi
sp. nov.
: 15, 17–19 Male; 16, 20, 21 Female. 15 Dorsal view; 16 Dorsal view; 17 Palp, prolateral view; 18 Palp, ventral view; 19 Palp, retrolateral view; 20 Epigynum, ventral view; 21 Epigynum, dorsal view. Abbreviations: cd—copulatory ducts, cy—cymbium, e—embolus, ep—epigynal plate, ma—median apophysis, rta—retrolateral tibial apophysis, S1—primary spermathecae, st—subtegulum, ta—terminal apophysis.

FIGURES 22–29 .
Camillina suya
sp. nov. : 22–27, 29. Female; 28 Male. 22 Carapace, dorsal view; 23 Chelicerae, ventral view; 24 Endites, ventral view; 25 Sternum, ventral view; 26 Trichobothrial bothrium with transverse ridges (arrow) on metatarsus II, dorsal view; 27 Tarsal organ on tarsus II, dorsal view; 28 Preening comb on metatarsus III (arrows), ventral view; 29 Pedipalp claw (arrow), lateral view. Abbreviations: ed—endites, l—labium, ste—sternum, TO—tarsal organ.

FIGURES 30–35 .
Camillina suya
sp. nov. : 30–34 Male; 35 Female. 30 Palp, ventral view; 31 Palp, retroventral view; 32 Embolus, detail ventral view; 33 Tegulum, detail ventral view; 34 Retrolateral tibial apophysis, detail; 35 Epigynum, dorsal view. Abbreviations: cd—border of the copulatory ducts, cy—cymbium, bg—Bennett’s glands, e—embolus, fd—fertilization ducts, ma—median apophysis, rta—retrolateral tibial apophysis, S1—primary spermathecae, S2—secondary spermathecae, st—subtegulum, ta—terminal apophysis, te—tegulum.

: Male: 36 Carapace, dorsal view; 37 Chelicerae, ventral view; 38 Endites, ventral view; 39 Sternum, ventral view; 40 Trichobothria on tarsus IV, dorsal view (arrow); 41 Tarsal organ, dorsal view (arrow); 42 Preening comb on metatarsus III, ventral view (arrows); 43 Claws, lateral view (arrow shows the teeth of the claw). subSubSection.paragraph:
Other material examined .
BRAZIL :
Mato Grosso
:
1♂ , Querência , Fazenda Tanguro , 12°49’55”S 52°20’21.6”W ,
29.V–05.VI.2006
( MPEG 31036 —SEM sample)
.
Variation . Length ( 10♂ ) total 3.09–3.79, carapace 1.35–1.76, femur I 0.87–1.34.
Distribution . Northeastern part of the State of Mato Grosso , Brazil .
Life history and habitat preferences . The same of C. suya .
